title: Admin || Dashboard - Build Dashboard for Admins
custom_steps:
As a part of the MLB Broadcast team, I want visibility into the broadcaster approval process, so that I can ensure that teams are approving broadcasters and that broadcasters are only airing games they've been approved for.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a609a682f61489e9a72



1. Mocks are implemented.

2. Broadcast Admins can view all clubs radio approvals.
a. Who has completed their approvals.
b. Which match-ups they're missing.

3. Tabs for
a. *Regular Season*
b. *Postseason*
c. Each tab displays only data matching the tab.

4. Filters for
a. *Year*
b. *Team*
c. Each filter only displays data that matches selected values.

5. Table with
a. Org - Displays all Major League teams as separate line items.
b. Status - Complete/Incomplete - Status updates from *Complete* to *Incomplete* when _Incomplete Orgs_ column reads N/A.
c. Updated in real-time as clubs submit their approvals.
* Incomplete Orgs
* Displays all orgs the team in _Org_ has yet to complete broadcast approvals for.
* Org appears as 3 letter abbreviation (ie ORG). 
* Updated in real-time as clubs submit their approvals.

6. Clicking/tapping on a team name brings the user to the club's approvals page.

7. Mobile responsive.
a. Collapse All functionality enabled.
b. Expand functionality enabled.

8. Table has vertical scroll functionality.

9. Seen only by BATTER Admins.

title: Admin || Broadcast Approvals - Functionality
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to view which visiting broadcasters have been approved to broadcast, so that unapproved stations can't air games they've not been approved for.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a609a682f61489e9a72 




1. Mocks are implemented.

2. *Team* filter displays only the selected team in the Approvals table.
3. Table functions the same as the club Approvals table.

4. Mobile responsive.
a. Collapse All functionality enabled.
b. Expand functionality enabled.

title: Admin || Broadcast Approvals - Layout
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to view which visiting broadcasters have been approved to broadcast, so that unapproved stations can't air games they've not been approved for.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a609a682f61489e9a72 



1. Mocks are implemented.

2. Top rail displays:
a. *Regular Season* tab and season status.
b. *Postseason* tab and season status.
c. *Year* filter
d. *Team* filter

3. Left rail displays:
a. List of _all_ Major League clubs.
b. Red/green status circle to the left of the club's name.

4. Approvals table added.
a. *Series* filter
b. *Load Previous Season Responses* filter
c. *Submit* button
d. *Cancel* button (as needed)
e. State
f. City
g. Station
h. Miles from ___ Ballpark.   (___ replaced by visiting team abbreviation.)
i. Approval Status

5. Mobile responsive.
a. Collapse All functionality enabled.
b. Expand functionality enabled.

title: Admin || Add/Remove Broadcasters - Layout
custom_steps:
As an Admin, I want to view, add, remove, and edit all broadcaster in a club's master list, so that I can ensure clubs are maintaining an up-to-date inventory of radio stations. 

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a283158fab7124a60b1 


1. Mocks are implemented.

2. Top rail displays:
a. *Year* filter - Displays broadcasters from only the selected year.
b. *Club* filter - Displays broadcasters of only the selected team. - NOTE: This is the only difference from the Club's *Add/Remove Broadcaster tab*.
c. *New Broadcaster* button

3. Broadcaster master list displays. 
a. State
b. City
c. Station
d. Miles from ___ Ballpark.  (___ replaced by logged in (home) team abbreviation.)

4. Edit/Remove/New Broadcaster functionality functions the same as club Add/Remove Broadcasters table.

5. Table has vertical scroll.

6. Mobile responsive.
a. *Collapse All* functionality enabled.
b. Expand functionality enabled.

custom_steps:
*ACTUAL*

title: Club || Add/Remove Broadcasters - Edit Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Club, I want to edit broadcasters in my master list, so that their available information is up to date.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a58ceb802339dc4d727

*AC*

1. Functionality additionally enabled for Admin roles.

2. Clicking/tapping the pencil icon triggers an Edit modal.
a. State 
b. City
c. Station
d. Miles from ___ Stadium  ( ___ replaced by logged in (home) club. )
e. All fields are required, *except Miles from ___ Stadium*

3. Clicking/tapping *Save* and *Cancel* complete the user's intended action.

4. Editing a broadcaster triggers the Saved confirmation message.

5. As broadcasters are edited, updates appear in the Broadcaster's line item in the Approvals table.

title: Club || Add/Remove Broadcasters - Remove Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Club, I want to be able to delete broadcasters from my master list, so that they no longer have to be approved/denied by other clubs.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a58ceb802339dc4d727


*AC*

1. Functionality additionally enabled for Admin roles.
2. Clicking/tapping the trash icon triggers the Delete modal
3. Clicking/tapping *Delete* and *Cancel* complete the user's intended action.
4. Deleting a broadcaster triggers the Broadcaster deleted confirmation message.
5. As broadcasters are deleted, they should *no longer* appear as a Broadcaster in the Approvals table.

title: Club || Add/Remove Broadcasters - Layout
custom_steps:
As a Club, I want to view my broadcaster master list, so that I can stay apprised of my radio affiliates. 

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a64c4f68a66c3c2e3ed 

*AC*

1. Mocks are implemented.

2. *Year* dropdown displays in top rail.
3. Broadcaster master list of _home team_ displays. 
a. State
b. City
c. Station
d. Miles from ___ Ballpark.  (___ replaced by logged in (home) team abbreviation.)
e. Table displays broadcasters from only the selected year.
f. _Pencil icon_ displays as leftmost element of line item.
g. _Trash icon_ displays to right of pencil icon.

4. Table has vertical scroll.

5. Mobile responsive.
a. Collapse All functionality enabled.
b. Expand functionality enabled.

title: Club || Broadcast Approvals - Layout
custom_steps:
As a home club, I want to view which visiting broadcasters can broadcast my game, so that I can stay up to date with approved radio affiliates.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a6c72d104756b0b3fa1 



*AC*

1. Mocks are implemented.

2. Top rail displays:
a. *Regular Season* tab and season status.
b. *Postseason* tab and season status.
c. *Year* dropdown filter

3. Left rail displays:
a. List of _all_ Major League clubs.
b. Red/green status circle to the left of the club's name.

4. Approvals table added.
a. Team matchup: ORG vs. ORG
b. *Series* filter
c. *Load Previous Season Responses* filter
d. *Submit* button
e. *Cancel* button (as needed)
f. Columns show as:
* State
* City
* Station
* Approval Status (Asterisk to convey required status.)

5. Mobile responsive.

title: Club || Add/Remove Broadcaster - Table Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Club, I want to remove broadcasters from the broadcaster master list, so that I can maintain an up-to-date inventory of radio stations.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a64c4f68a66c3c2e3ed 
Mobile Collapse: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a1c4a96d4c499b83182

*AC*

1. Mocks are implemented.

2. Data in table maintained by _home_ clubs.
a. As they edit/update their master list, this is reflected in their radio affiliate lists when club counterparts are approving/denying _visiting_ club radio affiliates.

3. Clicking/tapping New Broadcaster prompts the New Broadcaster modal.

4. Clicking/tapping the pencil icon prompts an Edit Broadcaster modal.

5. Clicking/tapping the trash icon prompts a Delete Broadcaster modal.

6. *Year* filter displays broadcasters from only the year that is selected.

7. Mobile responsive.
a.  Collapse All functionality enabled.
b. Expand functionality enabled.

8. Seen by BATTER Club and Admin.

title: Club || Broadcast Approvals - Notify Visiting Broadcasters of Approval Status
custom_steps:
As a visiting club, I want to be notified of my broadcasters' approval statuses, so that I can notify them of their ability to air, as needed.

*AC*

1. Email sent to visiting clubs with templated approval status of their broadcasters upon home club's confirmation.
a. Only one email will be sent with a table of all series approvals by broadcaster.

2. If a station is an affiliate of multiple clubs, radio station will appear in approval emails sent to both clubs upon submission of their affiliate approvals.

3. *Contacts provided in the attached excel file will receive approvals for only their respective clubs.*

title: Club || Add/Remove Broadcasters - New Broadcaster Functionality
custom_steps:
As a Club, I want to add broadcasters to the broadcaster master list, so that I can maintain an up-to-date inventory of radio stations.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a58ceb802339dc4d727

*AC*

1. Functionality additionally enabled for Admin roles.

2. Clicking *New Broadcaster* prompts the Add Broadcasters modal with *required* fields:
a. State
b. City
c. Station Name
d. Distance from ballpark

3. Clicking/tapping *Save* and *Cancel* completes the user's intended action.
a. Saving triggers the *Saved* confirmation message.

4. As clubs add broadcasters:
a. Their completion status as a visiting club will flip from green to red when other clubs view the left rail of their Approvals screen.
b. Their completion status as a visiting club will flip from Complete to Incomplete when other clubs view the top rail of their Approvals screen.
c. They should appear as a line item in the Broadcaster table of the Approvals screen for both Admin and Clubs.
d. They should appear as a line item in the club's broadcaster master list.

5. Mobile responsive.
a. Collapse All functionality enabled.
b. Expand functionality enabled.

6. Seen by BATTER Club and Admin.

title: Club || Broadcast Approvals - Functionality
custom_steps:
As a home club, I want to choose which visiting broadcasters can broadcast my game, so that unapproved stations can't air my game.

Zeplin: https://app.zeplin.io/project/5a0f1d4f4dcff4ca30221618/screen/66db2a6c72d104756b0b3fa1

*AC*

1. Mocks are implemented.

2. Radio Approvals tab added to Club's BATTER view.

3. Clicking/tapping a club from the left rail displays that club's broadcaster affiliate list in the Approvals table.

4. All radio affiliates of the selected _visiting_ club are shown.
a. Radio stations within 50 miles of the visiting stadium are grayed out.
b. Radio stations within 50 miles of visiting stadium are automatically approved.

5. Approvals are completed by match-up.
a. Clubs can only approve/deny broadcasters for _their home_ _games._
6. Approvals will be requested two times a year.
a. Regular Season and Postseason.

7. Once the user completes their approvals by clicking/tapping {{Submit}}â€¦
a. All Incomplete or red UX markers will change to Complete or green.
* If not completed, they remain Incomplete or red.

 b. The *Submit* button disappears and a Submission time appears in its place.
 c. Visiting clubs will be notified of their broadcasters' approval statuses.
 * Email is sent to the visiting team with a message that reads "The following TEXAS RANGERS radio affiliates have been approved to distribute radio broadcasts of games between the TEXAS RANGERS and SEATTLE MARINERS during the 2025 MLB season" followed by a numbered list of approved Radio Affiliates.  (NOTE: Rangers + Mariners used as example)

8. Filters and tabs will function as intended.
a. *Year* filter will display approvals/denials and broadcaster list from the selected year when clicked/tapped.
b. *Series* filter will display Approvals for the selected series when clicked/tapped.
* Series filter will reflect updated information if a Series is moved.

 c. *Regular Season* tab will display approvals for the regular season when clicked/tapped.
 d. *Postseason* tab will display approvals for the postseason when clicked/tapped.

9. Table has vertical scroll.

10. Mobile responsive.
a. Collapse All functionality enabled.
b. Expand functionality enabled.

11. Approvals table updated in real-time as broadcasters are added/removed from the *Add/Remove Broadcasters* tab.

title: Admin, Club || Broadcast Approvals - Enable/Disable Buttons When Approval Actions are Taken
custom_steps:
As a BATTER owner, I only want to enable users to submit Radio Affiliate changes when no Radio Affiliates need actions taken.

*AC*

1. IF any Radio Affiliates have not had action taken to approve/deny, *Submit* button is disabled.
3. Red circle does not display once *Submit* has been clicked.
4. Once submitted, a timestamp displays under the *Submit* button (Ex: Email sent: Wed, Apr 2, 2025 at 12:50 PM ET)

title: Admin, Club || Broadcast Approvals - Highlight Club Name When Viewing Their Approvals
custom_steps:
As a BATTER user, when I'm viewing a Club's Approvals screen, I want that Club's name to be highlighted.

*AC*

* Clicking/tapping on a Club name highlights the name until user clicks/taps on another Club name.

* Up to two club names can be highlighted at once:
a. The Club name for the Approvals the user is viewing.
b. The Club name the user is hovering over.

title: Admin, Club || Table Sort - Add Table Sort by Clicking/Tapping on Header Functionality
custom_steps:
As both an Admin and Club member, I want to sort tables by clicking/tapping on table headers.

*AC*

1. Clicking/tapping a column header sorts the table by that column.
a.Clicking/tapping the column again will sort the table the opposite way.
b. Displays a triangle in direction of sort (ascending: up, descending: down).
c. Defaults Ascending.

2. Table sorting works for Admins.

3. Table sorting works for Club members.

4. Table sorting works on:
a. _Add/Remove Broadcasters_ table.
b. _Approvals_ table.
